thread.title: Andrew Scott won't talk about his Spectre character: "That would spoil the fun, wouldn't it?" - Movies
thread.title_full: Andrew Scott won't talk about his Spectre character: "That would spoil the fun, wouldn't it?" - Movies News - Digital Spy

author: Ian Sandwell
title: Andrew Scott won't talk about his Spectre character: "That would spoil the fun, wouldn't it?" - Movies
text: Andrew Scott is remaining tight-lipped about his character in Spectre.The Sherlock star plays a member of the British government called Max Denbigh, but won't confirm anything else. © Sony PicturesAndrew Scott in Spectre Which Bond movie is best? The definitive 007 film ranking - from awful to awesome"That would spoil the fun, wouldn't it?" Scott told The Guardian."Let's put it this way. I get to wear great suits and do a lot of really fun, proper James Bondy stuff."To be in a James Bond film is just really cool, right?"Scott did at least note that he has "some really funny lines" in the latest 007 adventure, something he views as essential."My least favourite type of acting is acting that has no humour in it," he revealed. "I'd go as far as to say that it's unforgivable." © Sony PicturesSam Mendes and Daniel Craig on the set of Spectre Rewind! Watch Daniel Craig's 10 years as James Bond in a surreal 40 secondsSpectre marks Scott's first blockbuster work and he added that he enjoyed more than he expected to."Sam [Mendes] is such an exciting person to work with," he said. "He made it feel as if we were putting on a play, albeit with about 500 people standing around watching us rehearse."Meanwhile, a creepy new IMAX poster for the film was released last week, which channels classic Bond film Live and Let Die.Spectre opens on October 26 in the UK and worldwide on November 6.
